thread.title: UA Football: Henry On Mackey Award List
thread.title_full: UA Football: Henry On Mackey Award List

title: UA Football: Henry On Mackey Award List
text:
UA Football: Henry On Mackey Award List UA Football: Henry On Mackey Award List 
TIMES RECORD FILE PHOTO / Arkansas’ Hunter Henry carries after a reception against Ole Miss in the second quarter in Fayetteville in November 2014. Arkansas News Bureau 
FAYETTEVILLE — Arkansas tight end Hunter Henry furthered his award campaign Wednesday. 
Henry was named to the John Mackey Award midseason watch list as the college football season hit its midway point. Henry has 21 catches for 286 yards and a touchdown. The receptions and yards rank him second on the team and 10th and 13th in the nation among tight ends. They also place him first among tight ends in the Southeastern Conference. 
Henry was named to the award’s preseason watch list, as well. He was also a preseason All-American by several publications and called the highest-rated draft-eligible tight end in college football earlier this season. 
The John Mackey Award is given to the nation’s top collegiate tight end and the winner is announced Dec. 9. The watch list will be trimmed to semifinalists Nov. 16 and to finalists on Nov. 24.
